intro: Herpetophytum scopula, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a terrestrial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in racemes, and it is known for its ability to survive in harsh conditions. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to anchor firmly in rocky substrates. Herpetophytum scopula is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with well-draining soil.
